title: Calories in Cucumber Salad
meta_description: Discover calories in cucumber salad per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition tweaks for variations like creamy or oil-based dressings.
assumptions: Simple vinegar-based cucumber salad with sliced cucumbers, red onion, dill, a touch of olive oil and vinegar; ~150 g per 1-cup serving, no added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and dressing type. Check labels or recipes for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One cup of simple cucumber salad provides about 68 kcal, mostly from veggies with minimal fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp yogurt for creamy version per cup
Use oil-based dressing (extra 1 tsp oil) per cup
Add cherry tomatoes (50 g extra per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of cucumber salad?
faqs.a: About 68 kcal for a simple vinegar-dressed version.
Yes, around 9.8 g carbs per cup, with 1.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: What makes cucumber salad higher in calories?
faqs.a: Added oils, creams, or sugars in dressings can increase calories significantly.

faqs.q: How much protein in cucumber salad?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 1.5 g per cup from cucumbers and onions.

faqs.q: Can I make cucumber salad lower calorie?
faqs.a: Use lemon juice instead of oil for under 50 kcal per cup.
